com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.identifier.reference

Class Reference

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.identifier.reference.AbstractReferences
      • com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.identifier.reference.Reference
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DocumentIdentifiers, IndexingIdentifiers, QueryIdentifiers, References, Iterable<Reference>

    public class Reference
extends AbstractReferences
    A representation of a document reference. A document reference is a string, and optionally a section number, that identifies a document within IDOL's Content server. Though references allow for complex many-to-many relationships with documents, they are usually one-to-one or one-to-many by convention.

      • toIndexingString

        public String toIndexingString()
        The string representation of this identifier, suitable for use as part of a DREREPLACE.

        Sectioning does not apply for index commands so the section number is discarded.

        Specified by:
        toIndexingString in interface IndexingIdentifiers
        Overrides:
        toIndexingString in class AbstractReferences
        Returns:
        A suitably encoded string for use with index commands
